_header: As I me went this ender day / Fast in my way
Note:
See 6205; Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler TM 193; critical edition Flasdieck (1934)
XFlasdieck, Hermann Martin. Tom der Reimer, von keltischen feen und politischen propheten.
Wort und Bra 22. Breslau: Marcus, 1934; there are many prophecies of this name in the sixteenth century, some variants, others bearing no relation to this text.
Bibliographic Ghosts:
Oxford, Bodleian Library Ashmole 337 (SC 6683): from Robbins and Cutler (1965)
XRossell Hope Robbins, and John L. Cutler. Supplement to the Index of Middle English Verse. Lexington, Kentucky: University of Kentucky Press, 1965; not in this MS; Oxford, Bodleian Library Rawlinson D.1062 (SC 13814), ff. 92-93*: see 6205.
_description: Thomas of Erceldoune’s Prophecy, in three ‘Fyttes’ — in quatrains or five-line stanzas, or others irregular

BodAsh1386.First Lines:
…A chylde with a Chapell shall araye him rightwith manye a
                    hardie man of hande…
BodAsh1386.Last Lines:
…when it pleaseth him to callto heaven bringe you &
                    me
BodAsh1386.Note:
Garbled and disordered fragment of Fytte III; contains prose
                    insertions.
BodAsh1386.Attributed Author: The prophesie of Sir Thomas of Askledown (p. 277)
BodAsh1386.Attributed Title: The prophesie of Sir Thomas of Askledown (p. 277)
BodAsh1386.Editions:
Brandl,  Alois Leonhard. 
             Thomas of Erceldoune.
Sammlung Englischer Denkmäler in Kritischen Ausgaben.
         Bnd. 2. Berlin: Weidmann, 1880: 127.

BodHat56.First Lines:
Thomas of wandrith & of woughA dolefull tale tell the I
                    shall…
BodHat56.Last Lines:
…There shall he dey without laynGod take his soule in blys to
                    be
BodHat56.Note:
Fragment, 144 lines in quatrains; corrupt version of Fytte
                    III.
BodHat56.Editions:
Brandl,  Alois Leonhard. 
             Thomas of Erceldoune.
Sammlung Englischer Denkmäler in Kritischen Ausgaben.
         Bnd. 2. Berlin: Weidmann, 1880: 118-23.

CULFf548.First Lines:
As I me went þis endyrs dayffast on my way makyng my
                    mone…
CULFf548.Last Lines:
…Ihesu crowned with thorne so clereBryng vs to thy hall on
                    hye
CULFf548.Editions:
Murray,  J. A. H.,
                        ed.  
             The Romance and Prophecies of Thomas of Erceldoune
EETS 61 o.s. 61 (1875); repr. 1987.

             Illustrations of the Fairy Mythology of A Midsummer Night’s

         London: Shakespeare Society, 1845. 
Downing,  Janay Young A.,
                        ed.  
             “A Critical Edition of Cambridge University MS Ff.5.48.”

Nixon,  Ingeborg,

             2 vols.

BLCottVitEX.First Lines:
In a lande as I was lentIn the grykyng of þe
                    day…
BLCottVitEX.Last Lines:
…man wold I here þat couth tel more of þis
                    ferly…Kyng so clere brynge vs to þi hall…
BLCottVitEX.Note:
Imperfect: 564 lines. Folio number reflects the most recent foliation.
                    Manuscript damage.
BLCottVitEX.Attributed Title:
Incipit prophecia Thomas de Arseldon (f. 240v); explicit
                        Thomas de Arseldoun (f. 243)
BLCottVitEX.Editions:
Murray,  J. A. H.,
                        ed.  
             The Romance and Prophecies of Thomas of Erceldoune
EETS 61 o.s. 61 (1875); repr. 1987. 
Scott,  Sir Walter. 
             Minstrelsy of the Scottish Border.
         Edinburgh and London: Oliver and Boyd, 1932; revised 
                Henderson
            : 4.92.
Nixon,  Ingeborg,
                        ed.  
             Thomas of Erceldoune.
             2 vols. 
             Publications of the Department of English, University of
                Copenhagen
         9/1-2. Copenhagen: Akademisk Forlag, 1980-1983.

BLHar559.First Lines:
In vs Iudge the truthe as before ws hathe bento Iudge we may all
                    þat shalbe seen…
BLHar559.Last Lines:
…Then your maydens ley within your stronge walleffor after
                    þis no harme to your Rewllme shall falle
BLHar559.Note:
Fragment, 19 lines; late sixteenth-century variant in Oxford,  Bodleian Library Arch. Selden B. 8 (SC 3338), f. 21. Folios renumbered so this was formerly folios
                        31v-32; prophecy relates to events of 1553 according to line 3:
                    ‘a thowsand five hundreth fyfte two & one’ (f.
                    31v).
BLHar559.Editions:
Brandl,  Alois Leonhard. 
             Thomas of Erceldoune.
Sammlung Englischer Denkmäler in Kritischen Ausgaben.
         Bnd. 2. Berlin: Weidmann, 1880: 124-5.

BLSl2578.First Lines: ffarewell thomas I wend my wayeI may no longer dwell with the…
BLSl2578.Last Lines: …to beare the price of curteseand thus departid she & he
BLSl2578.Note: Imperfect: 332 lines; lacks 321 lines of Fytte I. Followed by “ffinis” (f. 11v), then by 6434.
BLSl2578.Attributed Author: the second fytt of sir thomas of Arseldoun (f. 6)
BLSl2578.Attributed Title: Heare begynethe þe second fytt I sayeof sir thomas of Arselday (f. 6)

Lincoln91.First Lines:
Als I me wente þis Endres dayefful faste in mynd makand my
                    moneIn a mery mornynge of maye…
Lincoln91.Last Lines:
…A rounde with a crowne of brere[Bry]nge vs to his heuene so
                    hyee
Lincoln91.Note:
Imperfect: 636 lines and a prologue of 24 lines, beg. ‘Lystyns
                    lordyngs bothe grete & smale / And takis gude tente what I will
                    saye…’; ff. 152, 153 torn.
Lincoln91.Attributed Author:
Tomas Off Ersseldoune (f. 149v); Explicit Thomas Of
                    Erseledownne (f. 153v)
Lincoln91.Facsimiles:
Brewer,  Derek Stanley,  and  A. E. B. Owen.

             The Thornton Manuscript (Lincoln Cathedral MS. 91).
         London: Scolar Press, 1975.
